answers.answer: Peek's sleeping, she worked last night. SHe should be back online around 3pm PST.Is he doing u/s to check progress? I only ask because some docs will just do fundal heights witch are not terribly accurate.How has your diet been? Fluid levels? These are all questions that need to be answered before the cause can be figured out and of course no one can tell you when to consider induction except your doc. Wish I could be more help.

I was told with Lilith that they don't start worrying till the 15%-10% of things, then they get concerned and if it drops below 10th percentile then they induce/c-section early.  There was some concern about her size because of the medications I was on from the surgery.

Yes he is doing u/s weekly, only biophysicals, 3 weeks ago he said that baby had to much fluid then 2 weeks ago he said his fluid is good, Ihave gest diabetes and am trying to follow diet not always the best at it though, just worried that if he is not growing properly then something should be done?

Sounds like you are getting good care, and they are closely monitoring your pregnancy and the baby's growth.  If it drops way down, as IO said, then they will consider earlier delivery.  With GD, the baby's lungs may not be as mature now as they would be in 2 weeks.

question: Last week my doctor told me that my baby's growth has dropped to 38th percentile from 50th, I want to know, when is this dangerous? If I go this week and it has dropped more, at what point should I be worried?  I am 36 weeks and last week he measured about 38 weeks..... I guess what I want to know is at what point is early delivery necessary?
title: 36 weeks gestational growth? -Peek?
